paper_abstract: We present a mathematical-computational model of the development of Alzheimer's disease, based on the assumption that cholesterol plays a key role in the formation of neuropathological lesions that characterize the disease: the senile amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary tangles. The final model, conceived as a system of equations, was simulated by a computer program.
paper_title: A model of the role of cholesterol in the development of Alzheimer's disease
